Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into four registers: 1 - Two jackals on biers. 2 - Two rows of Hieroglyphic text. 3 - Representation of deceased and wife separated by a column of Hieroglyphic text; two more columns to the right. 4 - Four rows of Hieroglyphic text.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.17)
